channel.title: Scheduled queries are not being executed and were found in outdated queries after some times
channel.description:
It has been observed that the redash queue for scheduled queries has been piling up on certain days and all of the queries in scheduled mode going into outdated queries. How to resolve the above problem?
Redash Version: 8
Thanks

item.title: Scheduled queries are not being executed and were found in outdated queries after some times
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
Sounds like your scheduler is crashing periodically. This was a known issue in V8 which we solved by switching from Celery to RQ in V9 and above.

Read full topic
item.source: Scheduled queries are not being executed and were found in outdated queries after some times

item.title: Scheduled queries are not being executed and were found in outdated queries after some times
item.dc:creator: rvshnkr
item.description:
@jesse I have not got any relevant logs. Initially, there are 8 workers so we had to increase it with 16 workers but that doesnâ€™t work and the same thing is happening once a week . There are no long-running queries on avg the query takes 5min. Yes, ad-hoc queries run as normal.
After restart, scheduled queries runs fine but after some days the scheduled queries are not executed for many hours and it goes to outdated queries ?
Thanks

Read full topic
item.source: Scheduled queries are not being executed and were found in outdated queries after some times

item.title: Scheduled queries are not being executed and were found in outdated queries after some times
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
Do you see any relevant info in your logs? How many workers do you have? Are these long-running queries? Do ad-hoc queries run as normal?

Read full topic
